message:
If you work on a Huge project like myself and you have a lot of people in your team touching the code at the same time then you MUST use Gitflow. Here is a screencast on how to use it.

And this is the command line tool to make things faster: https://github.com/nvie/gitflow
story: Mohamed Alaa El Din shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: How to use a scalable Git branching model called Gitflow - Drupal Video Tutorial | BuildAModule
caption: buildamodule.com
description: Throughout this series you've seen the number of branches that we use in order to manage our workflow growing. So to begin with, we started with a single branch called master and this is the branch that gets created when our repository is originally initialized, and we did all of our development onâ€¦

data.message: You can do the same with TFS and Microsoft Visual Studio
What do you think of the business model of this website? Isn't the market saturated? Maybe not?

@TFS might be working only for Microsoft Technologies. But why you need to waste time and money on infrastructure while you can resolve it with $10 dollars a Months!

Sorry Mohamed Meligy didn't get your question well. can you please explain more?
TFS is free up to 5 users
This is a subscription based information video products site (with freemium style). I'm talking about this business model, and whether the market for these are already saturated
Visual Studio Online and BitBucket both have free plans up to 5 users.

Yes, but with 5 Users you don't need to use a flow like that! I'm talking when you work on a project with 60 developers and You have a release manager and you need to know from where to branch what! 

If you have 5 users team you can shout to the other 4 who did that :D but when you work with over 60 person in the same code base you need to have a process.
